metadata.title: CVE-2019-9578 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
In devs.c in Yubico libu2f-host before 1.1.8, the response to init ismisparsed, leaking uninitialized stack memory back to the device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9578` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libu2f-host0 - 1.1.9-1
libu2f-udev - 1.1.9-1
u2f-host - 1.1.9-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libu2f-host package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.9-1').
